intro: Acianthera gracilis, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. It has a complex root system that helps it absorb nutrients from the soil. Acianthera gracilis is a member of the Orchidaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often showy floral structures.
